title: The Sniper Anthology: Snipers of the Second World War
description:
The Sniper Anthology: Snipers of the Second World War - Martin Pegler (ed.) [epub]

Dramatic first-hand accounts of daring sniper missions. Revered by some as the ultimate warrior and condemned by others as ruthless assassins, the combat sniper is more than just a crack shot. This collection of biographies, written by leading military historians, explores the careers of the top snipers of World War II, such as Vassili Zaitsev, Simo HÃ¤yhÃ¤, and Sepp Allerberger.

Remarkable resources including firsthand accounts provide the authors insight into the snipers' skill and personae. These gripping, in-depth narratives go beyond the cursory treatment in existing histories and are essential reading for anyone wanting to learn about the role and technique of the sniper during the Second World War
